section.title: Verify the Installation
section.para: You can run these commands from the proxy server or any server with access to the Identity Service. Look for the default_swift_cluster setting in the proxy-server.conf and match the URLs (including http or https) when issuing auth commands.

listitem.para: First, export the swift admin password (setup previously) in a variable so it can be re-used.

note.para: If you do not wish to have the swift admin password stored in your shell's history, you may perform the following:

screen.userinput: export SWIFT_PROXY_CONF="/etc/swift/proxy-server.conf export ADMINPASS=$( grep super_admin_key ${SWIFT_PROXY_CONF} | awk '{ print $NF }' )

listitem.para: Run the swift CLI, swift, with the correct Identity service URL. Export the information for ADMINPASS using $ export ADMINPASS=secretword.
Check that you can HEAD the account:
Use swift to upload a few files named ‘bigfile[1-2].tgz’ to a container named ‘myfiles’:

screen.userinput: swift -A http://<AUTH_HOSTNAME>:5000/v2.0 -U openstackDemo:adminUser -K $ADMINPASS upload myfiles bigfile1.tgz
swift -A http://<AUTH_HOSTNAME>:5000/v2.0 -U openstackDemo:adminUser -K $ADMINPASS upload myfiles bigfile2.tgz
